text:
Lyndon is a city in Osage County, Kansas, United States. It is also the county seat of Osage County. In 2010, 1,052 people lived there.
History.
Lyndon was created in 1869. It was created after the land in the area was taken from the Sac and Fox Nation and opened for settlement. It was named after Lyndon, Vermont.
Geography.
Lyndon is at (38.610233, -95.685352). The United States Census Bureau says that the city has a total area of. All of it is land.
Climate.
Lyndon has hot, humid summers and generally mild to cool winters. The Köppen Climate Classification system says that Lyndon has a humid subtropical climate, abbreviated "Cfa" on climate maps.
People.
Lyndon is part of the Topeka metropolitan area.
2010 census.
The 2010 census says that there were 1,052 people, 422 households, and 285 families living in Lyndon.
